data.title: Amazon Plans To Hire 100,000, Raise Wages To Address Coronavirus Impact
data.text: Amazon stock rose in after-hours trading Monday as the e-commerce giant said it would hire an additional 100,000 employees in the U.S. to meet the rising demand in online shopping.

data.title: Amazon is looking to hire 100,000 employees to keep up with demand
data.text: Amazon is looking to hire 100,000 new employees for its warehouse and delivery operations in the U.S. to keep up with demand during the current coronavirus outbreak, the company said today.

data.title: Amazon to hire 100,000 workers as online orders surge on virus worries
data.text: Amazon.com Inc  said on Monday it would hire 100,000 warehouse and delivery workers in the United States to tackle a surge in online orders, as consumers shop heavily fearing the spread of the coronavirus outbreak.

data.title: How Is Amazon’s Stock Holding Up Since the Spread Of Coronavirus?
data.text: Amazon (NASDAQ: AMZN) stock took a big hit, falling by about 11.8% since March 8, (through March 12), as the broader S&P 500 fell by over 16.5%. The stock is down by a total of over 16.5% since early February.

data.title: Amazon says running out of popular household staples, sets up $25 million fund to support delivery workers
data.text: Amazon.com Inc. AMZN, +6.46% said it is running out of popular brands and items, especially in the household staples area, as more people shop on line in the midst of the coronavirus outbreak.
